section.p: For iOS devices with multiple rear cameras, such as dual (wide and ultra-wide) or triple (wide, ultra-wide, and telephoto) cameras, you can first call and set cameraFocalLengthType to CAMERA_FOCAL_LENGTH_DEFAULT (0) (standard lens), then set the zoom factor to a value less than 1.0 to achieve ultra-wide-angle video capture.

ul.li: This method is only applicable to Android and iOS platforms.

You must call this method after calling . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully enabled, that is, after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).

section.note: You must call this method after calling . This setting takes effect after the camera is successfully started, i.e., after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).

plentry.pd: The camera zoom factor. You can call to get the maximum zoom factor supported by the device. For devices that do not support ultra-wide-angle, the value ranges from 1.0 to the maximum zoom factor supported by the device; for devices that support ultra-wide-angle, the value ranges from 0.5 to the maximum zoom factor supported by the device.
Camera zoom factor. You can call to get the maximum zoom factor supported by the device.

ul.li: 0: Success. Returns the set camera zoom factor.
If the method call succeeds, returns the value of the camera zoom factor factor.
If the method call fails, returns a value less than 0.
